[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/H5MRIbN.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Newly Created Alloy Could Change the Game for Vehicles With Metal Tires[/color][/b] 
While not many own vehicles that utilize metal tires, those that do will reportedly see a huge boost in performance in tires using this alloy. The team boasts that one could skid around the Earth's equator five hundred times before needing to be replaced. They also say that this alloy is the first metal to be placed in the same grouping as diamond, as it is a hundred more times durable than high-durability steel. The small team had this to say about future applications “These wear-resistant materials could potentially provide reliability benefits for a range of devices we have explored. The opportunities for integration and improvement would be device-specific, but this material would provide another tool for addressing current reliability limitations of metal microelectronic components.” Exciting developments are indeed coming out of Sandia laboratories.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://share-ng.sandia.gov/news/resources/news_releases/resistant_alloy/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Paleontological Find Proves Breeding Between Two Hominin Species[/color][/b] 
This story starts with the perishing of a thirteen-year-old girl in the Altai Mountains around ninety thousand years ago. This poor girl was the offspring of a Neanderthal and a Denisovan. This discovery is significant because it is the first ever recorded instance of the pairing. There had previously been hypotheses suggesting this, but the evidence had not been uncovered until now.  This girl was not the only instance of crossbreeding either; upon further analyzing her genome researchers found instances of both species' DNA in spades. Viviane Slon, Ph.D., a post-doctoral researcher at the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology had this to say regarding their numerous breakthroughs; “We only have DNA sequences from a few ancient homimins, about 20 of them, and to find a half-Neanderthal, half-Denisovan individual among them was a big surprise, This told us that they had the opportunity to encounter each other and these people must have interacted more frequently that we had previously thought.”- [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.inverse.com/article/48304-ancient-human-mating-neanderthal-denisovan]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/lv4d7BY.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Cohen's lawyer says he's completely flipped and will give evidence that Trump colluded with Russia[/color][/b] 
Michael Cohen, President Trump’s “former longtime personal lawyer,” will now be testifying against his former boss. Lanny Davis, Cohen’s lawyer, said in a statement that Michael Cohen “knew of efforts by Trump to conspire with Russia to corrupt the 2016 presidential election.” When defending Trump, Cohen continuously denied the U.S. President’s involvement in any collusion. Davis foreshadowed the fact that Cohen ‘had knowledge on certain subjects that could be of interest to the special counsel.’ On this past Tuesday, 21 of May, Cohen pleaded guilty to several charges. Those charges include campaign finance violations ordered directly by then-President-elect Donald Trump. Further stating his plea, Cohen’s lawyer began providing small details regarding ‘the special counsel’s investigation into Russian election interference.’ Davis delved into specifics, saying that Cohen would provide Robert Mueller and the special counsel with exact evidence that Trump worked alongside Russia to influence the election. Cohen’s decision is coming four months after the FBI raided his home, hotel room, and office, where they collected a sum of over 4 million documents. Just 0.2% of the documents seized would be excluded from FBI inspection.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://nordic.businessinsider.com/lanny-davis-cohen-flipped-on-trump-has-evidence-of-russia-conspiracy-2018-8]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]China hits carbon goal 12 years early[/color][/b] 
China has established its presence as the most contributing source to carbon emissions in the world for some time now; however, the country hit their carbon goals 12 years early, a study shows. In 2018, a year where climate change is an ever-evolving topic that seems to be more and more tangible each day, hope may be near. According to the Paris climate accord, China was given until 2030 to meet the planet-warming emission levels agreed upon. Well, just 12 years early and China has accomplished just that, according to a study published in Nature Geoscience. Between the years 2007 and 2016, the country’s industrialization and coal consumption declined greatly, which is the cause of the goal being met so rapidly, scientists say. Over the past few years, China’s economy has continued to grow, and they’ve been able to stabilize their emissions. Though the decline is not substantial (9.5 billion tons of greenhouse gasses in 2013 down to 9.2 billion in 2016), declining is better than inclining. After “nearly three decades of rapid growth, China passed the United States to become the world’s largest source of carbon emissions in 2006. And with the Trump administration walking away from the Paris accord and trying to roll back its predecessors’ steps to meet that pact’s goals, what happens in China takes on outsized importance in the battle against climate change.” Though some analysts aren’t as optimistic as others, seeing that China’s coal consumption rose again in 2017 and is expected to continue rising in 2018, Beijing has taken an initiative to burn less coal for power, along with developing environmentally efficient steel and cement plants.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/china-worlds-biggest-polluter-hits-carbon-goals12-years-early?ref=home]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Tyk8rsw.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Halo Master Chief Collection Releases On Xbox Game Pass This September[/color][/b] 
Many things have been unveiled during this years Gamescom, including the announcement about Xbox exclusive - Halo. Purchasing the Xbox Game Pass includes, but not limited to, Halo: Combat Evolved, Halo 2, Halo 3, Halo 3: ODST, and Halo 4. You're limited to campaign only for the ODST collections, but the multiplayer access is enabled for the other games. If you happen to snag this deal before August 31, 2018, new members will pay two dollars for a two month access pass. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/halo-master-chief-collection-releases-on-xbox-game/1100-6461297/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]New Star Wars Games Coming to Mobile[/color][/b] 
The developer of online games such as FarmVille and Words with Friends is partnering with Disney to create Star Wars video games for Mobile devices. Zynga bought out the company NaturalMotion in 2014, which was known for its games "CSR Racing" and "Backbreaker Football," among many others. Zynga's, NaturalMotion studio, is controlling operations of the previous mobile game, Star Wars Commander while planning on releasing two more Star Wars video games on the mobile platform.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/two-new-mobile-star-wars-games-coming/1100-6461330/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]The Division 2 In-Game Location[/color][/b] 
We saw the first look at Tom Clancy's The Division 2 at E3 this year. This game is an online action role-playing video game, developed by Massive Entertainment. As the game release is coming upon us, more details about the game are starting to come out. One of those, where the game's location is going to take place. Many cities were being considered for the location, such as Seattle and New Orleans. After consideration, they have chosen Washington D.C. The first Division's location was set in New York City, so the developers wanted to give it a similar feel to the game. D.C. gives them the ability to incorporate a vast surrounding, such as nature and inner city areas. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.pcgamer.com/the-division-2-could-have-been-set-in-seattle-or-new-orleans/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]
